TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit WSHttpContextBinding extends System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding

Docs.summary: Provides a context-enabled binding for the

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpContextBinding> adds a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextBindingElement> to the stack of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement> objects in the system-provided <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding>. This enables SOAP headers to be used to exchange context when HTTP cookies are not enabled.
> [!NOTE] > When calling a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service built with [!INCLUDE[netfx40_long](~/includes/netfx40-long-md.md)] from a WCF client application built with [!INCLUDE[netfx35_long](~/includes/netfx35-long-md.md)] or earlier, the configuration file generated by svcutil.exe or adding a service reference from [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] contains the `contextManagementEnabled` attribute in the binding configuration. This attribute is not recognized by the [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] runtime and the application throws a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationErrorsException> with the message "Unrecognized attribute 'contextManagementEnabled". To workaround this problem, remove the `contextManagementEnabled` attribute from the binding configuration.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `configName` parameter should be set to the name of the `<binding>` element in the configuration file that configures this binding.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElementCollection CreateBindingElements() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates an ordered collection of binding elements that are contained in the current binding.
Docs.returns: The ordered stack of binding elements described by the .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The collection contains the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextBindingElement>, which enables SOAP headers to be used to exchange context when HTTP cookies are not enabled; otherwise use HTTP cookies to exchange context.
